div.p: Throughout the Y’s history, we have been called upon in times of crisis, conflict and strife to provide critical services.

span.strong: Y’S KIDS ENRICHMENT FOR EMERGENCY PERSONNEL

div.p: In the past week, the Whatcom Family YMCA and Ys throughout the nation have been contacted by emergency services about providing childcare for their mission-critical staff. At the same time, we have heard an uproar of concern from families in Y programs: Without schools in session, they cannot work, and without work, they cannot provide for their families.

With the support and assistance of Whatcom County and public health officials, the Y is currently offering full-day emergency K-5th programs for EMS, law enforcement, firefighters, medical staff, pharmacy staff, and grocery store workers.
During this enrichment program, children will enjoy arts, crafts, STEM, active play, learning loss support and supervision from our experienced Y staff.

span.strong: For more information contact Victoria, vsteiner@whatcomymca.org or 360-255-0585

div.p: Children whose parents are first responders, medical personnel or work in a pharmacy or grocery store.

ul.li: Adults and children will wash and sanitize hands upon arrival and throughout the day
Our staff and registered nurses will monitor children and look for symptoms of COVID-19 and other exclusionary illnesses
School facilities will be cleaned and disinfected throughout the day following recommended Health Guidelines.

Cascadia Elementary School (Ferndale)
Additional sites will open as needed.

div.p: If you need to call to register, please call 360-255-0585 and leave a voicemail if staff not available. For more help, please contact Victoria, vsteiner@whatcomymca.org
Financial assistance available & DSHS subsidy accepted.

div.a: Register for Y's Kids Emergency Care at Parkview Elementary: April 20-May 1
Register for Y's Kids Emergency Care at Cascadia Elementary: April 20-May 1
